title: Toy example interpreting the co-ranking Matrix
text: co-ranking matrix tool assess quality dimensionality reduciton. fishbowl data set consists sphere hole top:  Dimensionality reductions:  corresponding co-ranking matrices :  one can observe, t-SNE tears data, points close far apart, e.g. upper border fish bowl. reflected co-ranking matrix higher values upper right part. PCA crushes points, data set gets flattened points far away close now, manifests values lower left part co-ranking matrix. t-SNE also tends keep smaller distances points, .e. values close diagonal higher upper left part, PCA keeps larger distances, .e. values close diagonal lower right higher.
code: scatterplot3d(data$x, data$y, data$z,               xlab = "x", ylab = "y", zlab = "z",               color = data$col) dim.red <- list() ## dim.red$isomap <- isomap(dist(data[c("x","y","z")]), k = 20) ## dim.red$kpca <- kpca(~x + y + z, data) dim.red$tsne <- Rtsne(data[c("x", "y", "z")]) dim.red$pca <- princomp(data[c("x", "y", "z")]) ## plot(dim.red$isomap$points, col = data$col) ## plot(rotated(dim.red$kpca), col = data$col) plot(dim.red$tsne$Y, col = data$col,      xlab = "tsne I", ylab = "tsne II",      main = "t-SNE") plot(dim.red$pca$scores, col = data$col,      xlab = "PCA I", ylab = "PCA II",      main = "PCA") Q.tsne <- coranking(data[c("x", "y", "z")], dim.red$tsne$Y) Q.pca <- coranking(data[c("x", "y", "z")], dim.red$pca$scores[, 1:2]) imageplot(Q.tsne, main = "t-SNE") imageplot(Q.pca, main = "PCA")

what: A parameter free quality measure for dimensionality reduction
title: Toy example interpreting the co-ranking Matrix
text: Defined Lueks et al. (2011). general quality measure depending KK defined : QNX(K)=1KN∑k=1K∑l=1KQklQ_{NX}(K) = \frac{1}{KN} \sum_{k=1}^{K}\sum_{l=1}^{K}Q_{kl} values QNX(K)Q_{NX}(K) split local global values Kmax=argmaxKLCMC(K)=argmaxK(QNX−KN−1)K_\max = \arg\max_K\text{LCMC}(K) = \arg\max_K\left(Q_{NX} - \frac{K}{N-1}\right)  QlocalQ_\text{local} mean values left maximum, QglobalQ_\text{global} mean values right maximum. Kmax=6K_\text{max}    = 6 Qlocal=0.856425Q_\text{local}  = 0.856425 Qglobal=0.8664873Q_\text{global} = 0.8664873 Kmax=50K_\text{max}    = 50 Qlocal=0.5189708Q_\text{local}  = 0.5189708 Qglobal=0.8298335Q_\text{global} = 0.8298335 QlocalQ_\text{local} considered important QglobalQ_\text{global}.
code: qnx.tsne <- coRanking:::Q_NX(Q.tsne) qnx.pca <- coRanking:::Q_NX(Q.pca) lcmc.tsne <- LCMC(Q.tsne) lcmc.pca <- LCMC(Q.pca) Kmax.tsne <- which.max(lcmc.tsne) Kmax.pca <- which.max(lcmc.pca)  yrange <- range(c(qnx.tsne, qnx.pca)) plot(qnx.tsne, xlab = "K", ylab = expression(Q[NX]), type = "l", ylim = yrange, col = 1) abline(v = Kmax.tsne, col = 1, lty = 2) text(Kmax.tsne, mean(yrange) + 0.1, expression(K[max]), col = 1, pos = 4) lines(qnx.pca, main = "PCA", xlab = "K", ylab = expression(Q[NX]), ylim = 0:1, col = 2) abline(v = Kmax.pca, col = 2, lty = 2) text(Kmax.pca, mean(yrange) - 0.1, expression(K[max]), col = 2, pos = 4) legend("bottomright", legend = c("t-SNE", "PCA"), lty = 1, col = 1:2)

title: Area under the RN_X curve — AUC_ln_K
text: value, area curve.

title: Area under the RN_X curve — AUC_ln_K
text: calculated : $$ AUC_{\ln K}(R_{NX}(K)) = \left(\sum_{K=1}^{N-2}R_{NX}(K)/K\right)/\left(\sum_{K=1}^{N-2}1/K\right) $$

title: Area under the RN_X curve — AUC_ln_K

title: The local continuity meta-criterion — LCMC
text: number, local continuity meta-criterion

title: The local continuity meta-criterion — LCMC
text: local continuity meta-criterion (Chen Buja, 2006) defined $$ LCMC = \frac{K}{1-N} +               \frac{1}{NK} \sum_{(k,l)\U  L_K} q_{kl} $$ Higher values mean better performance dimensionality reduction.

title: The local continuity meta-criterion — LCMC
text: Guido Kraemer

text: Lueks, W., Mokbel, B., Biehl, M., & Hammer, B. (2011).   Evaluate Dimensionality Reduction? - Improving Co-ranking Matrix.   ArXiv:1110.3917 [Cs]. http://arxiv.org/abs/1110.3917

title: The \(Q_{NX}(K)\) criterion — Q_NX
text: Guido Kraemer

title: The \(R_{NX}(K)\) criterion — R_NX
text: curve indicating improvement embedding random embedding neighborhood size \(K\). Values range 0, random embedding, 1 perfect embedding.

title: The \(R_{NX}(K)\) criterion — R_NX
text: Q co-ranking matrix

title: The \(R_{NX}(K)\) criterion — R_NX
text: vector values R_NX(K)

title: The \(R_{NX}(K)\) criterion — R_NX
text: \(R_{NX}(K)\) calculated follows: $$ Q_{NX}(K) = \sum_{1\leq k\leq K}\sum_{1\leq l\leq K} \frac{q_{kl}}{KN} $$ Counts upper left \(K\)--\(K\) block \(Q\), .e. considers preserved ranks diagonal permutations within neighborhood. $$ R_{NX}(K) = \frac{(N-1)Q_{NX}(K)-K}{N-1-K} $$ resulting vale 0 corresponds random embedding, value 1 perfect embedding \(K\)-ary neighborhood.

title: The \(R_{NX}(K)\) criterion — R_NX
text: Lee, J.., Lee, J.., Verleysen, M., 2009. Quality assessment     dimensionality reduction: Rank-based criteria. Neurocomputing 72. Lee, J. ., Peluffo-Ordóñez, D. H., & Verleysen, M., 2015. Multi-scale   similarities stochastic neighbour embedding: Reducing dimensionality   preserving local global structure. Neurocomputing, 169,   246–261. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neucom.2014.12.095
